name: Museo Ferrocarril
excerpt: Serious trainspotters might want to take a look inside this huge hangar of a museum, which houses several salt-crusted train engines and carriages. It's…
detail_description: Serious trainspotters might want to take a look inside this huge hangar of a museum, which houses several salt-crusted train engines and carriages. It's not possible to board the trains and there is little signage, making the exhibits rather dull.

name: Cementerio de Trenes
excerpt: The only real attraction in Uyuni, Cementerio de Trenes is a rusty collection of historic steam locomotives and rail cars dating back to the 19th century,…
detail_description:
The only real attraction in Uyuni, Cementerio de Trenes is a rusty collection of historic steam locomotives and rail cars dating back to the 19th century, when there was a rail-car factory here. Today they sit decaying in the yards about 3km southwest of the modern-day station along Av Ferroviaria.
They’re fun to climb on, and it’s a nice walk from town to keep you warm. Most tours visit the train cemetery as a first or last stop on the three-day salar (salt desert) circuit.

name: Church
excerpt: The simple church on Colón is a local landmark.
detail_description: The simple church on Colón is a local landmark.

name: Workers' Monument
excerpt: This local landmark pays homage to the common man.
detail_description: This local landmark pays homage to the common man.

name: Monumento a Los Héroes del Chaco
excerpt: This monument is dedicated to the fallen in the brutal Chaco War.
detail_description: This monument is dedicated to the fallen in the brutal Chaco War.

name: Stranded Locomotive
excerpt: This rusty old carriage is located near the train station.
detail_description: This rusty old carriage is located near the train station.

name: Clock Tower
excerpt: This European-style clock tower was built in 1930 with a clock mechanism that was imported from Germany. You can find the tourist police office here.
detail_description: This European-style clock tower was built in 1930 with a clock mechanism that was imported from Germany. You can find the tourist police office here.

name: Museo Arqueología y Antropológico de los Andes Meridionales
excerpt: A small museum featuring mummies, long skulls, fossils, ceramics and textiles. There are Spanish descriptions of the practices of cranial deformation. At…
detail_description: A small museum featuring mummies, long skulls, fossils, ceramics and textiles. There are Spanish descriptions of the practices of cranial deformation. At research time the museum was closed for renovations.
